text:
Katerina Ivanovna sat at the table, anxious. 

“Raskolnikov!” she exclaimed, delighted. 

He entered, apologizing. 

“I’m sorry I missed the funeral,” he said. 

“Sit here!” she insisted, placing him on her left. 

She whispered to him, laughter bubbling up. 

“It’s all that cuckoo’s fault!” she pointed at Amalia Ivanovna. 

“Look at her, she’s clueless!” 

Katerina coughed, then continued, 

“Why wear that ridiculous cap?” 

Laughter erupted again, mixed with coughs. 

Raskolnikov smiled, caught in her fervor. 

The dinner carried on, tension lingering.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Katerina Ivanovna expresses her frustrations about the dinner and her guests while eagerly engaging Raskolnikov in conversation.
